gurmukhi: sXwm igrwvq BXo niRp kau niRp hUM rQ qy hir BUm igrwXo ] kauqk hyr srwhq By Bt sRI hir ko niRp ko jsu gwXo ]1648]
transliteration: Syaam Giraavat Bhayo Nrip Kau Nrip Hoon Rath Te Har(i) Bhoom-giraayo|| Koutak Her Saraahat Bhe Bhat Srihar(i) Ko Nrip Ko Jas(u) Gadyo||1648||
translation: Sometimes Krishna and sometimes the king caused the other to fall from the chariot; seeing this spectacle the minstrels began to praise the king and Krishna.1648.

gurmukhi: ieq sXwm cFXo rQ Awpn pY rQ pY auq sRI KVgyS cFXo ] Aiq kop bFwie mhwN icq mY iqh mXwnhu qy krvwr kFXo ]
transliteration: It Syaam Chadhyo Rath Aapan Pai Rath Pai Out Srikhadgesh Chadhyo|| At(i) Kop Badhaae Mahaan Chit Mai Tih Myaanoh Te Karvaar Kadhyo||
translation: On this side Krishna mounted his chariot and on the other side, the king Kharag Singh ascended his vehicle; the king, in fury, drew out his sword from the scabbard;

gurmukhi: su Gno dl pMf ky puqRn ko iris qyj kI pwvk sMg fFXo ] Dun byd kI AsqRin SsqRin kI ibiD mwnhu pwrs swQ pFXo ]1649]
transliteration: Su Ghano Dal Pand Ke Poutran Ko Ris(i) Tej Kipaavak San Dadhyo|| Dhoun Bed Kiastran(i) Shastran(i) Kibidh(i) Maanoh Paaras Saath Padhyo||1649||
translation: The army of Pandavas also got ablazed with anger, it appeared that the sound of the weapons and arms was the recitation of the Vedic mantras.1649.

gurmukhi: sRI durjoDn ky dl ko liK BUp qbY Aiq bwn clwey ] bwNky kIey ibrQI qh bIr Gny qbhI jmDwm pTwey ]
transliteration: Sridurjodhan Ke Dal Ko Lakh(i) Bhoop Tabai At(i) Baan Chadhaae|| Baanke Keee Birthitah Beer Ghane Tab-hijamdhaam Pathaae||
translation: Seeing the army of Duryodhana, the king showered his arrows; he depriving many warriors of their chariots, dispatched them to the abode of Yama;

gurmukhi: BIKm dRaux qy Awidk sUr Bjy rx mY n koaU Thrwey ] jIq kI Aws qjI bhuro KVgyS ky swmuih nwihn Awey ]1650]
transliteration: Bheekham Draoun Te Aadik Soor Bhaje Ran Mai Na Ko( i)  Thahraae|| Jeet Kiaas Tajibahuro Khadgsh Ke Saamuh(i) Naahin Aae||1650||
translation: The warriors like Bhishma and Drona ran away from the battlefield and relinquishing all hope of victory, they did not come again before Kharag Singh.1650.

gurmukhi: dRauxj Bwnuj kiRpw Bij gey n bwDI DIr ] BUr sÍw kurrwj sB try lKI rn BIr ]1651]
transliteration: Draounaj Bhaanuj Kridaa Bhaj(i) Gad Na Baadhidheer|| Bhoor Sravaa Kur-raaj Sabh Dare Lakhiran Bheer||1651||
translation: Forsaking their endurance, the son of Drona, the son of Surya and Kripacharya ran away and seeing the dreadful fighting Bhurshrva and Duryodhana also fled.1651.

gurmukhi: Bwjy sBY liK kY su juiDStir sRI piq ky qt AYsy aucwrXo ] BUp bfo blvMq kiRpwinD kwhU qy pYg tirE nhI twrXo ]
transliteration: Bhaaje Sabhai Lakh(i) Kai Su Judhishtar(i) Sripat(i) Ke Tat Aise Ouchdaryo|| Bhoop Bado Balvant Kridaanidh Kaahoo Te Paig Tario Nahitdaryo||
translation: Seeing all of them fleeing, Yudhishtar said to Krishna, “This king is very powerful and is not receding by anyone;

gurmukhi: Bwnj BIKm dRaux kiRpw hm pwrQ BIm Gno rn pwrXo ] so nih nYku trY rn qy hmhUM sBhUM pRB paurK hwrXo ]1652]
transliteration: Bhaanaj Bheekham Draoun Kridaa Ham Paarath Bheem Ghano Ran Pdaryo|| So Nah(i) Naik Darai Ran Te Ham-hoon Sabh-hoon Prabh Paurakh Hdaryo||1652||
translation: “We have waged a terrible war with him, taking Karan, Bhisham, Drone, Kripacharya, Arjuna, Bhima etc. with us but he did not even slightly get aside from war and all of us had to surrender.1652.

gurmukhi: BIKm Bwnju Aau durjoDn BIm Gno hT ju`D mcwXo ] sRI muslI brmwkiRq swqk kop Gno icq mwNJ bFwXo ]
transliteration: Bheekham Bhaanaj(u) Au Durjodhan Bheem Ghano Hath Juddh Nachadyo|| Srimouslibarmaakrit Saatak Kop Ghano Chit Maanjh Badhaayo||
translation: “Bhisham, Karan, Duryodhana, Bhim etc. waged a persistent and Balram, Kratvarma, Satyak etc. also became extremely enraged in their mind;
